performance_metrics.name: Assembly Cycle Time (per unit)
performance_metrics.description: The average time taken by the robot to complete the entire assembly process for a single product. Lower cycle times typically translate to higher throughput and reduced labor costs.

performance_metrics.name: Throughput (units/hour)
performance_metrics.description: The number of products assembled per hour. This is directly influenced by cycle time and robot utilization.

performance_metrics.name: Accuracy (tolerance)
performance_metrics.description: The permissible deviation from the specified dimensions of the assembled product. Critical for precision assembly applications.

performance_metrics.name: Repeatability
performance_metrics.description: The consistency of the robot's movements and assembly quality. Important for producing parts with identical specifications.

performance_metrics.name: Robot Utilization
performance_metrics.description: The percentage of time the robot is actively performing assembly tasks. Lower utilization indicates downtime due to maintenance, programming, or other factors.

performance_metrics.name: First-Pass Yield
performance_metrics.description: The percentage of assemblies that are produced correctly the first time, without requiring rework or repair.

implementation_requirements.name: Robot Arm Configuration
implementation_requirements.specifications: 6-Axis Articulated Robot Arm with a Payload Capacity of 15-30 kg and a Reach of 1200-1800 mm
implementation_requirements.description: Provides sufficient dexterity and force for a wide range of assembly tasks.  The specific configuration depends on the complexity of the assembly process.

implementation_requirements.name: End-of-Arm Tooling (EAT)
implementation_requirements.specifications: Vacuum Gripper, Pneumatic Gripper, or Custom Tooling based on component type.
implementation_requirements.description: The device attached to the robot arm that physically interacts with the components. Must be compatible with the robot arm and the assembly process.

implementation_requirements.name: Workcell Design
implementation_requirements.specifications: Fixed or Movable Workcell, incorporating a conveyor system, vision system, and safety barriers.
implementation_requirements.description: The layout of the robot, components, and other equipment. A well-designed workcell optimizes material flow and minimizes cycle times.

implementation_requirements.name: Safety System
implementation_requirements.specifications: Light Curtains, Safety Fencing, Emergency Stop Buttons (rated to ISO 13849-1)
implementation_requirements.description: Measures to prevent injury to personnel operating the robot. Requires compliance with relevant safety standards.

implementation_requirements.name: Vision System Integration
implementation_requirements.specifications: High-Resolution Camera (5MP or greater), 3D Vision System (optional)
implementation_requirements.description: For component identification, positioning, and quality inspection. Integration with robot control system is crucial.

implementation_requirements.name: Control System
implementation_requirements.specifications: Robot Controller (Siemens, ABB, FANUC), PLC for System Integration
implementation_requirements.description: Software that manages robot movements, communicates with other equipment, and handles data logging.

industry_standards: ISO 10218-1: Industrial Robots – Safety Requirements – General Safety Standards
ISO 13849-1: Functional Safety – Part 1: Requirements for Safety Instrumented Systems
IEC 61508: Functional Safety of Electrical/Electronic/Programmable Electronic Control Systems
ANSI B15.15: Industrial Robots – Safety Requirements
operational_considerations: Preventative Maintenance Schedule (based on manufacturer recommendations)
Operator Training (on robot programming, troubleshooting, and safety procedures)
Process Monitoring and Data Logging (for performance analysis and optimization)
Change Management Procedures (for any modifications to the assembly process)
